summary: This is a transcript of a conference before Judge Richard M. Berman in the Southern District of New York regarding the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein. The discussion centers on bail arrangements, the status of victim notifications, the relevance of Epstein's 2007/2008 Florida non-prosecution agreement (NPA) to the New York charges, and the implications of a recent search of Epstein's residence. Defense counsel argues the NPA bars the new prosecution, while the government contends it does not bind the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The accused in the sex trafficking case. His bail status, sex offender registration, and the applicability of a prior non-prosecution agreement are the central topics of the hearing.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: Presiding judge for the conference. He asks questions about victim notification, Epstein's sex offender status, the Florida NPA, and schedules the bail hearing.

persons.name: Reid H. Weingarten
persons.context: One of Epstein's defense attorneys. He argues that the current prosecution is a 're-do' of the previously resolved Florida case and is barred by the 2007 non-prosecution agreement.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Another defense attorney for Epstein. He provides detailed arguments about the scope and legality of the Florida NPA, referencing ongoing CVRA litigation in Florida.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York. He is listed as appearing but does not speak in the provided transcript excerpts.

persons.name: Marc Fernich
persons.context: Attorney for the defendant, listed as present but does not speak in the provided transcript excerpts.

persons.name: Keyana Pompey
persons.context: Probation officer present at the conference.

persons.name: Lea Harmon
persons.context: Probation officer present at the conference.

persons.name: Judge Pitman
persons.context: Magistrate Judge who handled Epstein's initial presentment and arraignment earlier on the same day. The bail hearing is being referred from him to Judge Berman.

persons.name: Judge Marrah
persons.context: Mentioned by defense counsel as the judge presiding over the CVRA (Crime Victims' Rights Act) litigation in the Southern District of Florida related to the 2007 NPA.

connections.description: Weingarten is acting as defense counsel for Epstein, arguing against bail conditions and the validity of the prosecution.
Weinberg is acting as defense counsel for Epstein, providing detailed legal arguments regarding the non-prosecution agreement.
Both are defense attorneys representing Jeffrey Epstein in the same proceeding.
Defense suggests Florida prosecutors may have 'steered' victims to New York, potentially violating the NPA. This implies a past and contentious legal relationship.

events.title: Initial Conference Before Judge Berman
events.description: A status conference is held following Jeffrey Epstein's arraignment. Key issues discussed include victim notification, Epstein's sex offender status, the relevance of the Florida NPA, and scheduling of the bail hearing.

events.title: Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA)
events.description: A non-prosecution agreement was signed between Jeffrey Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida, resulting in a state plea deal. This agreement is the central point of legal contention in the New York case.

events.title: Florida State Prosecution and Sex Offender Registration
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded to state offenses in Florida, served time, and was registered as a sex offender. In New York, this results in a Tier 3 (high-risk) designation.

events.title: Search of Epstein's New York Residence
events.description: Over the weekend prior to the hearing, the U.S. Attorney's office searched Epstein's townhouse on East 71st Street. The findings are described as 'extremely concerning' by the government regarding bail.

events.title: Scheduled Bail Hearing
events.description: Judge Berman schedules the full bail argument hearing for July 15, 2019, at 10:00 a.m., with written submissions due from defense on July 11 and government on July 12.

locations: United States District Court, Southern District of New York
Southern District of Florida (jurisdiction of the 2007 NPA)
keyFacts: The government asserts the 2007 Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement does not bind the Southern District of New York, as it expressly referred only to that district.
Defense argues the New York prosecution is a 're-do' of the already-resolved Florida case and is barred by the NPA, which they claim provided Epstein with immunity for the investigated conduct.
Epstein is characterized as a Tier 3 (high-risk) sex offender in New York as a result of his Florida conviction.
The government revealed a recent search of Epstein's New York townhouse yielded materials they describe as 'extremely concerning' for bail purposes.
The defense anticipates a legal challenge based on the scope of the NPA, suggesting Florida prosecutors may have improperly steered victims to New York.
